DataElement.preferredName: Growth Factor And Stem Cell Mobilization Therapy Therapeutic Procedure Tissue Donor Prior Harvest Procedure Enhance Collection Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the tissue donor received growth factor and stem cell mobiliziation therapy prior to the harvest to enhance the collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Growth Factor And Stem Cell Mobilization Therapy Therapeutic Procedure Tissue Donor Prior Harvest Procedure Enhance Collection Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Substances made by the body that function to regulate cell division and cell survival. Some growth factors are also produced in the laboratory and used in biological therapy._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Therapy to cause release of stem cells from the bone marrow into the peripheral blood circulation for the purpose of collection._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Earlier in time or order._Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation._To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Growth Factor And Stem Cell Mobilization Therapy Therapeutic Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Substances made by the body that function to regulate cell division and cell survival. Some growth factors are also produced in the laboratory and used in biological therapy.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Therapy to cause release of stem cells from the bone marrow into the peripheral blood circulation for the purpose of leukapheresis, prior to stem cell transplantion. Hematopoietic growth factors or chemotherapeutic agents often are used to stimulate the mobilization.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Growth Factors are extracellular signaling molecules (ligands) involved in control of target cell proliferation, cell survival, and cell differentiation. (NCI)
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Therapy to cause release of stem cells from the bone marrow into the peripheral blood circulation for the purpose of collection.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Donor Prior Harvest Procedure Enhance Collection Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:Earlier in time or order.:Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.:To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
Earlier in time or order.
Remove from a culture or a living or dead body, as for the purposes of transplantation.
To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
